protocol_name: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
protocol_name_html: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
description:
April 2000 chp

Phage are best purified by a CsCl gradient. This is separated by density not sedimentation as in a sucrose gradient.

This is a protocol for P22 like phage not T4 with delicate tail fibers.
warning: This is a protocol for P22 like phage, not T4 with delicate tail fibers.
guidelines:
This protocol is part of a larger collection of Cesium-Chloride related protocols. This is number (2) of (4):
1. Cesium Chloride Gradients
2. CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
3. Cesium Chloride and DNA Extraction of Viruses using Wizard Prep Columns
4. Cesium Chloride Dialysis for Viruses

Needed:
  • Phage
  • Beckman Ti45
  • 10% PEG
  • 0.5M NaCl
  • Centrifuge 8K GSA
  • CsCl
  • Buffer
  • Tris
  • MgCl2
  • SW 28.1 Beckman Ultra Clear Tube
  • Needle
  • Syringe
  • Guage Needle
  • Stop cork grease
  • Plunger
  • Pierce Dialysizer (optional)
  • 18 guage needle (necessary if using pierce dialysizer)
  • Tube
  • Mg buffer
To prepare a CsCl solution of a particular density, the percent by weight of CsCl can be calculated by the formula:
% wt/wt = 137.48 - 138.11/p
where 'p' is the desired density. For example, for p = 1.7 g/mL, use 56.24g CsCl and 43.76 mL H2O.

Grams of CsCl to be added to Buffer
p M 25 mls 50 mls 75 mls 100 mls 200 mls
1.3 2.4 10.10 20.20 30.31 40.41 80.82
1.4 3.2 13.47 26.94 44.16 53.86 107.76
1.45 3.6   30.24   60.48  
1.5 4 16.87 33.74 50.61 67.48  
1.55 4.4 18.48 36.96   73.92  
1.6 4.8 20.2 40.40      
1.65 5.2 21.89 43.78   87.55  
1.7 5.6 23.57 47.15 70.7 94.29  

(Yamamoto 1970 Virology 40, 734-744)

components.data:
To put on the top of the gradient we use two methods:

a. In the Beckman Ti45 1 hr 35K
b. PEG ppt using 10% PEG (6K) 0.5 M NaCl (Yamamoto 1970 Virology 40, 734-744)

source_data.annotation:
These were the volumes used from the author's experiment:
1.3 is 4 mls, 1.4 is 4 mls 1.5 is 3 mls, and 1.7 is 2 mls.

components.data: The band between 1.4.-1.5 can be pulled out with a syringe and 20 or above gauge needle.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 13 of CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.protocol_name: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.protocol_name_html: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.annotation:
This will act as your sealant.
 Phage are a bluish whitish band is between the 1.4 and 1.5. The higher bands are empty heads and the bottom stuff are ribosomes.
source_data.thread_text:
This will act as your sealant.
 Phage are a bluish whitish band is between the 1.4 and 1.5. The higher bands are empty heads and the bottom stuff are ribosomes.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 15 of CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.protocol_name: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.protocol_name_html: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.annotation: If you don't, it is tough to start pulling the band.
source_data.thread_text: If you don't, it is tough to start pulling the band.
source_data.body: If you don't, it is tough to start pulling the band.

components.data: Puncture by slowly twisting and pushing the needle, beveled side up, a few mm below the bluish white band.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Puncture by slowly twisting and pushing the needle, beveled side up, a few mm below the bluish white band.

components.data: Sealing
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 16 of CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.protocol_name: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.protocol_name_html: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.annotation: Once through, the resistance decreases and you might go through the other side so slowly. Even pressure is the key.
source_data.thread_text: Once through, the resistance decreases and you might go through the other side so slowly. Even pressure is the key.
source_data.body: Once through, the resistance decreases and you might go through the other side so slowly. Even pressure is the key.

components.data: Now through ensure the hole around the needle is sealed with grease. Collect the band by slowly moving the needle back and forth under the band
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Now through ensure the hole around the needle is sealed with grease. Collect the band by slowly moving the needle back and forth under the band

components.data: Sealing
components.name: Section

components.data: Change needle to a 18 gauge if using in a Pierce Dialysizer, if not, take needle off and put in a tube until you can dialyze it.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Change needle to a 18 gauge if using in a Pierce Dialysizer, if not, take needle off and put in a tube until you can dialyze it.

components.data: Dialyze
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 18 of CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.protocol_name: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.protocol_name_html: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.annotation: Change needle and syringe before going to the next tube even if it is the same sample. Repuncturing the tube dulls the needle enough where it can cause problems on the next collection.
source_data.thread_text: Change needle and syringe before going to the next tube even if it is the same sample. Repuncturing the tube dulls the needle enough where it can cause problems on the next collection.
source_data.body: Change needle and syringe before going to the next tube even if it is the same sample. Repuncturing the tube dulls the needle enough where it can cause problems on the next collection.

components.data: Dialyze the band against a high Mg buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dialyze the band against a high Mg buffer.

components.data: Dialyze
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 19 of CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.protocol_name: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.protocol_name_html: CsCl Step Gradient to Purify Phage
source_data.annotation: T4 needs to have step dialysis 1.1 because the heads will pop if put directly into a buffer without CsCl.
source_data.thread_text: T4 needs to have step dialysis 1.1 because the heads will pop if put directly into a buffer without CsCl.
